TypeSignature.Value: public abstract class DbDataReader : MarshalByRefObject, System.Collections.IEnumerable, System.Data.IDataReader

summary.para: Reads a forward-only stream of rows from a data source.
Initializes a new instance of the class.
Closes the object.

remarks.para: The outermost table has a depth of zero.

summary.para: Gets a value indicating the depth of nesting for the current row.

remarks.para: Call Dispose when you are finished using the . The Dispose method leaves the in an unusable state. After calling Dispose, you must release all references to the so the garbage collector can reclaim the memory that the was occupying.
For more information, see Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources and Implementing a Dispose Method.

block.para: Always call Dispose before you release your last reference to the . Otherwise, the resources it is using will not be freed until the garbage collector calls the object's Finalize method.

summary.para: Releases all resources used by the current instance of the class.
Releases the managed resources used by the and optionally releases the unmanaged resources.

Docs.param: true to release managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

remarks.para: Includes hidden fields. Use to exclude hidden fields.

summary.para: Gets the number of columns in the current row.
Gets the value of the specified column as a Boolean.

returns.para: The value of the specified column.

summary.para: Gets the value of the specified column as a byte.

returns.para: The value of the specified column.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract long GetBytes (int i, long fieldOffset, byte[] buffer, int bufferOffset, int length);

summary.para: Reads a stream of bytes from the specified column, starting at location indicated by , into the buffer, starting at the location indicated by .

returns.para: The actual number of bytes read.

Docs.param: The buffer into which to copy the data.
The index with the buffer to which the data will be copied.
The maximum number of characters to read.

summary.para: Gets the value of the specified column as a single character.

returns.para: The value of the specified column.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract long GetChars (int i, long dataIndex, char[] buffer, int bufferIndex, int length);

remarks.para: Although you can use this method to retrieve an explicit constructor, in languages that support an explicit foreach construct, it is simpler to use the looping construct directly in order to iterate through the rows in the data reader.
If you implement this method, it should return a new instance of or ensure that your enumerator returns objects.

summary.para: Returns an that can be used to iterate through the rows in the data reader.

returns.para: An that can be used to iterate through the rows in the data reader.

remarks.para: Call this method to check for null column values before calling the typed get methods (for example, , , and so on) to avoid raising an error.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract object this[int index] { get; }
public abstract object this[string name] { get; }

remarks.para: This method allows you to process multiple result sets returned when a batch is submitted to the data provider.

summary.para: Advances the reader to the next result when reading the results of a batch of statements.

returns.para: true if there are more result sets; otherwise false.

remarks.para: The default position of a data reader is before the first record. Therefore, you must call to begin accessing data.

summary.para: Advances the reader to the next record in a result set.

returns.para: true if there are more rows; otherwise false.

remarks.para: The RecordsAffected property is not set until all rows are read and you close the DataReader.

summary.para: Gets the number of rows changed, inserted, or deleted by execution of the SQL statement.

remarks.para: This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the instance is cast to an interface.

summary.para: For a description of this member, see .

returns.para: An instance of to be used when the field points to more remote structured data.

remarks.para: This value is used to determine how many fields in the are visible. For example, a SELECT on a partial primary key returns the remaining parts of the key as hidden fields. The hidden fields are always appended behind the visible fields.

summary.para: Gets the number of fields in the that are not hidden.
